website_summaries.verdict: A sleek countertop microwave oven that is perfect for preparing snacks or heating up leftovers.
pros: Includes an easy-to-grip handle to open and close the door
Strong construction with a durable front display and cabinet
Boasts an interior capacity of 0.6' and a 9.5" turntable
Ideal in an apartment, office, dorm room or other small area
cons: Delivers limited power in comparison to other microwaves

website_summaries.verdict: A bargain if you don’t care about bells and whistles, and don’t need a digital touchpad or a lot of power.
pros: Simple, no-frills design features dial controls and a variety of food cooking and thawing settings
Compact size is great for small spaces
Best for preparing small items and snacks
Handle is durable and easy to grip
cons: Turntable is loud and makes annoying squeaking sounds

customer_reviews.title: Good size-Great price-Easy to use-Not fancy-PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Great countertop microwave! If your looking for a great quality, simple to use, good size, amazing price microwave this is it! Not fancy is a plus for us! Did not want a clock or digital display, wanted sleek & simple. Back to basics simple to use for teenagers & seniors! Our family highly recommends this product! Got ours with free prime shipping & a huge discount! Total with state taxes was $56! UPDATE: As of today, 1/16/2019 it is still working perfectly just like it did the very first day!!! We do not use it every day, but often. So far so good!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Garbage / Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is garbage. Complete piece of garbage. After two months the turntable started squeaking, the noise is now intolerable. Only the highest setting works now also, turning down the power control is the same as no power at all. Timer doesn't seem to work either, setting it on a minute will go 2-3 minutes easily. Ridiculous waste of money. Taking it to Goodwill. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: vbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Not even one year old and the turntable is making all kinds of noise. Sounds like it is going to blow up. Got a bad one.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diann M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I ve been screwed..
customer_reviews.text: I Used it 6 times and now it will not come on.
customer_reviews.author: Selena Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 600 watt mico actually uses 1070 watts!.
customer_reviews.text: This 600 watt micro wave works real good and is very simple to use. Now, for those of you operating off solar power or an inverter ( semi-truck sleeper), mine uses 1070 watts of power no matter if it is set to low, or high power. My solar generator will handle it as long as I just heat stuff up and do not try cooking. Watt usage is always good to know 600 watts = 1070 watts. Good micro wave.
customer_reviews.author: GJW; Florida

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The damn thing wouldn't even turn on. I'm in Antarctica. I want a simple, small microwave to warm up canned food (because that's about the freshest food we get), so I ordered this POS. It arrived and it doesnt' work. I can't return it because I'm in Antarctica. It would take months to return it. So, I took a gamble to purchase it because it was cheap. Reviews were not good on it and now they're even worse. Yeah... don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: JMP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my very little kitchen. Manual reading mandatory!
customer_reviews.text: Great little microwave. Perfect for my very small kitchen. Wish the dials were a little more specific. I'd like to see increments of minutes so you don't have to guess between one and 2 minutes
customer_reviews.author: BriceSitesPublishing

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than a year and a half.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave was bought to use at my cabin to heat food that I brought from my house. So it is not like I was using it daily. By my calculations I have use it less then one hundred times, not one hundred days, one hundred times. And considering that I payed almost one hundred dollars that comes to about a dollar per use. If you don't have a problem with paying one dollar every time you want to heat something then this might be for you. But if you expect a microwave to last five to ten years like I do, especially when it is almost never used, then you might want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only a year
customer_reviews.text: The magnetron has stopped working after just over one year. It was inexpensive, that's true, but to stop working after 12 months is unacceptable. It's a bad deal because the slower warming time and lack of features is a trade-off for the lower price. After waiting all those extra minutes, the thing still breaks after a year. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: karsmo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little microwave
customer_reviews.text: Smallest microwave ever. Had to buy a special adapter that maybe Amazon should have suggested with this purchase. Three prong adapter to fit a 2 pronged outlet. Ent back to Amazon to buy it since no local stores had one. Perfect for what I needed. Popcorn, heating up soups and small plates of food. Power level dial and minute dial. That’s it. Nothing fancy, nothing difficult to use. Love it. Got the warranty for 4 years. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: fattymoko

customer_reviews.title: Solved issues and frustrations for 89 year old mom with dementia.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this microwave for my 89 year old mother who is suffering from dementia. She was really struggling with the push buttons on her other microwave, was getting confused and having a hard time remembering what buttons to push. This microwave has knobs that turn and are much easier for an elderly person or someone with dementia to use. By leaving the temp setting on high, all she has to do is turn the time knob to the time she needs. She quickly took to it and now her frustrations are gone. It's not a big microwave but perfect to heat a cup of water, soup, cook a microwave dinner or warm something up.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for use with a small off-grid solar system.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with my 1200W (concurrent) inverter and so long as I keep it on medium or below, works great for reheating coffee and leftovers. Trips the inverter on high, I'll probably end up getting a larger inverter as I increase my solar and battery capacity but this adds a valuable creature comfort for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome microwave!
customer_reviews.text: Love this microwave! The dials are basic and so great! It's small enough to fit inside my cabinet since I don't use it enough to want it sitting out all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Ohlin

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple, effective
customer_reviews.text: I just love this microwave oven. Exactly what I wanted. Exactly as described. Small. Simple. No vampire lights. No vampire trickle drain. No blinkies. Just two twist dials. I am a real cook, and prefer heat and flame for most jobs, but often a small microwave is handy for quick tasks, such as heating water or milk, warming a serving plate, reheating risotto. It is a small MW oven, so some items won't fit. If it were a bigger oven, then it would not be a small oven. Don't buy this oven expecting a massive microwave with a dozen presets.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very low power. Got what i paid for. Should spent more for a better unit. Works just takes twice as long. Good size for counter. Like the manual timer. Didn't help it was dented and beat up although the packaging was fine. Wouldn't recommend. Update. Replaced it with a different make and model already.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K.

customer_reviews.title: the better. This was absolutely PERFECT for her
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 93 year old Grandmother who suffers from macular degeneration. She had a similar microwave for years that bit the dust. I was in a panic because I was afraid I would not be able to find one with 2 dials and not a lot of technology. Small letters and buttons are her enemy right now, so, the easier, the better. This was absolutely PERFECT for her. She can heat up a cup of coffee, or leftovers without and trouble. She is as happy as a clam with this!!! I'm so glad I was able to find it for her!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindawg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. This is about the smallest
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. This is about the smallest,in terms of electrical use,that I could get. In addition,this is also the simplest. No digital programming,no readout. I bought this to use in a conversion van with a small solar system on the roof. I needed this to have a small enough current draw so that i could simultaneously run a refrigerator at the same. Worked great. Boils a half cup of water in 2 mins a full cup in 4. YEAH ITS A BIT SLOWER THAN THE BIGGER ONES BUT ITS DEAD SIMPLE TO USE! You can use this even if you're blind!. Serious,I tried it and highly recomend it for anyone with vision impairments.
customer_reviews.author: B Willie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived and damaged
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is exactly what I hoped it would be. I wanted one small and simple for my room at the assisted living facility where I live. My only problem is with the condition of the product when it arrived. The left side of the top is badly dented, as if it had been dropped (see photos). I did finish unpacking it, and powered it up. So far it is working as expected. If it continues to work ok, I will not return it, as the damage appears to be purely cosmetic.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Nice small, quiet microwave
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave because I live with roommates and I wanted a small microwave that didn't have those LOUD beeping noises. This one is nice and quiet, no buttons, and when the food is ready it just has one DING of a bell that's not too loud. It's not very strong even on the high setting, so you will have to heat up your food a bit longer than you might be used to. For example it took me about 5-6 minutes to cook frozen veggies. But for the price and what I needed it for, it works alright.
customer_reviews.author: snowdrop

customer_reviews.title: Simple microwave for heating up coffee or warming up foods.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to heat a cup of coffee for 2 minutes on medium high which equals about 80 percent power. Can probably go easily to high if you use cold creamer. I had to block a side with a small rubber wedge to keep it from sliding BUT remember to always hold the microwave on the right side when you open the door to the left. Looks sleek, simple to use and meets the needs that I have. I love the dials instead of push buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Jean Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Not The Best or The Longest Lasting Microwave I Ever Had!
customer_reviews.text: Believe I bought this 10 months ago. Three months ago it started making loud noises when the turntable was going around. Kept taking the part out that the glass plate sits on and putting it back in, that worked for awhile. Never had a microwave do this before. I googled it and it said it could be the magetron. I also don't like the features on this microwave, very inconvenient. I guess you get what you pay for.....
customer_reviews.author: NJS

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This microwave completely stopped working after occasional use after two years. Very very short life and I'm pissed that I have to throw this thing away and buy a new one. Such a waste of materials/products/plastic.
customer_reviews.author: betterworldbiker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.  Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Received 10 days ago. So far excellent. Plenty of power for our needs, relatively quiet, heats well, and does not move (on open wood shelf over counter) when opening the door. Good purchase for someone who wants a small, easy-to-use microwave. As for longevity, who knows? I replaced a 20 yr old Samsung only because the door was rusting. Hard to find these dial controlled units now - we prefer to avoid electronic touch panels because they often fail, take more time to use, and the light stays on when door open. We like to clear residual odors without having light on.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Learning

customer_reviews.title: Wanted something easy to operate because she has trouble with short term ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 93 year old mother. She was having a hard time reaching the microwave above the stove. Wanted something easy to operate because she has trouble with short term memory and also has macular degeneration. We've only had it a few days but she's using it and it works well. The numbers are small on the dial so I used a hole punch to make small dots from an adhesive label and attached them to the microwave at the 1,2,3 min marks (she generally uses 2 min for reheating things or boiling water for tea). The dots make it easier to see where to turn the dial.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Decent but short lived
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent microwave. It's a nice, compact size so it doesn't take up much space. The controls are very basic but get the job done. It completely died after 2 years and 2 months, so it didn't last all the long.
customer_reviews.author: TFP

customer_reviews.title: Easy for Elderly To Use
customer_reviews.text: Great product-- purchased it to ease having to manipulate time settings on newer models. This microwave is very powerful and out performs my over the stove updated one. My father who is past 85 finds it easier to use. Takes up very little space on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernGyrl

customer_reviews.title: Good microwave, but numbers too small for elderly
customer_reviews.text: This microwave seems solid, easy to clean, & is a decent size. But I had purchased it for my 93YO Mom to use, and the numbers/controls are too small to read for anyone with even slightly impaired vision. Even I have a hard time reading the numbers. They are squeezed in at the bottom, below all the "automatic" controls (that are pretty useless to someone that only wants to nuke a plate of food or warm up their coffee). I ended up using this one myself, & getting my Mom a basic microwave that has a simple dial control.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Salamon

customer_reviews.title: Turntable roller arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: We chose this microwave to replace our old one since the buttons couldn't be pushed anymore. Well, the old one started working again until today, so we finally opened this one after ordering it over a month ago. Packing was fine except for the inside where turntable and roller were stored. Glass was fine, but the plastic roller was broke, I assume from the glass hitting it since the styrofoam that was supposed to hold it in place was broken. Microwave works fine otherwise. Hopefully we can order a replacement part. Lesson learned. When I order something, I will open right away.
customer_reviews.author: Mari.S

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave when Off-Grid with a Generator or Solar Power!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great microwave for those camping as the power demand is the lowest of any microwave ovens on the market. It is easy to just turn the dial. If you are off-grid using solar this is a microwave that has the lowest power demand. I bought this as a backup for the one in my camping trailer because the market is changing to higher power microwave ovens. I need the lowest power unit available and don't care if it takes a few seconds longer to cook a meal while camping. Unfortunately the manufacturers are now catering to the consumers who complain about low-power microwave ovens taking but seconds longer to cook a meal.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hovander

customer_reviews.title: Good little microwave
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice microwave but small. It seems to take a little longer to heat items than other microwaves. The interior dimensions are 11.5" wide x 7.5" high x 10" deep. If you are looking for a small microwave to warm up your burritos and cook your hot pockets, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: tanyaj

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is a basic microwave option. I use my microwave 4-5 times a week to heat things minimally - 30 seconds to warm up dog food, a minute to reheat a cooled off cup of coffee, 2 minutes for a bowl of soup. With this minimal use this appliance should have lasted a lifetime- but it died after a year. It began to make a horrible sound and emit an electrical burning smell that was a little frightening. I will no buy again and will avoid this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Breadfruit Design

customer_reviews.title: I love the simplicity of the dials
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of the dials, and it seems to be well-made. I only gave two stars, however, because the power input is falsely rated at 850 W according to the sticker on the back and the user manual. When measured directly with two different meters the actual power draw was 1050 W. I purchased the microwave for use with a 1000 W inverter, so this false advertising means I get to package this thing and send back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Your Rayness

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Cost effective and easy to use. Definitely serves its purpose and doesn't take up too much counter space. I purchased this for use in my office and there are 18 of us that use it for lunches, etc. It's tall enough that you can put a 16 oz cup inside and wide enough to fit a dinner plate. The two knobs control the voltage (low to high heat) and time. Nothing fancy, but it fulfills our need for a microwave that used just to warm things up.
customer_reviews.author: Melin08

customer_reviews.title: Simple & efficient
customer_reviews.text: After looking at various microwaves to replace my ancient/broken mechanical one, I realized i only use the microwave for either heating a cup of liquid or frozen meals. I've had touch controls go bad on expensive appliances. A simple small microwave is all that I need. this unit works out very nicely. It is very light and has no door latch release so you can't just snatch it open. I use a thumb on case past door technique. The cherry is that this unit does have a turntable, my old one didn't.
customer_reviews.author: zenart

customer_reviews.title: Over 3 years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have used this microwave daily for over 3 years. I heat water and cook microwave meals and popcorn. It does the job but ordinarily takes 30 to 60 seconds longer than most directions. I only use the high setting. It also happens to be smaller than most microwaves.
customer_reviews.author: ~A

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Old Mechanical Style EMP resistant
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a spare microwave that I could double use as Faraday cage for other sensitive electronics and also have a working microwave to cook canned food in the case of a Carrington Event or nuclear EMP attack from China. Took apart simple easy to fix if need to.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Lew

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price....
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my office and works well. I like that the knobs are manual as opposed to keypad. Just be sure to remove all the tape before use. I found packing tape in the most bizarre of places. Will this last until retirement? I doubt it. However, for the price, it's worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Great little micro for a small space or cabinet
customer_reviews.text: We needed a small micro to fit in a cabinet about our toaster over. We rarely use the micro and have a hood range. So we opted to put it in a cabinet that had an outlet. It works great! And it’s tucked away when not in use. Easy for our kids to use too
customer_reviews.author: Suz Lin

customer_reviews.title: Small, Lightweight, Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Now how did I ever manage without this? I actually bought this to stow away in my bedroom closet because it's small, doesn't beep or make loud noises in the middle of the night as I work nights and don't want to wake everyone up. It's kind of what you would expect your boss to buy for the break room at work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: the weakest little microwave
customer_reviews.text: Never before have I had a microwave that was this lackluster. At first I thought it was my fault, when I put in a frozen meal and had it come out still frozen 4 minutes later. But no, even regular old food from the fridge comes out cold. I put my dinner in twice and sat down to eat it and still ended up with random cold patches. Will be returning whenever I can make it to the post office.
customer_reviews.author: Dunni

customer_reviews.title: A+ for ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents. Looking for a simple microwave without all of the settings and buttons that are hard to read. They love the fact that it is just a simple turn of the dial and be done. Also, it doesn't beep multiple times when you leave the food in which can get quite annoying with other models. It is a little hard to dial in smaller increments of time, so things where you need 15 seconds and not 30, you might have trouble with
customer_reviews.author: Erik Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a damaged unit from Amazon - there is a sizable dent in the back, but we knew that going in. Where it is placed, the dent does not show, and the microwave works perfectly other than that. The glass tray is a bit fiddly to re-align when you take it out, and it gets jostled off-center easily, so not five-stars. But, for a dial-controlled small microwave for a dorm or break room or RV, it is ideal
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Bob

customer_reviews.title: ... 16 months and has heavy use and is working perfect. I bought this to get away from touch ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for about 16 months and has heavy use and is working perfect. I bought this to get away from touch pads that i do not like. I love the knobs, and would advise you to purchase products like this with knobs only. They seem to be more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: a1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Assisted Living
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 97 yr old MIL to use in her ALF room. It was easy for her to learn, small enough for the room and she is not confused by controls she would never have used. Does the job and she makes a cup of tea for herself now and then.
customer_reviews.author: RiVog

customer_reviews.title: works great under harsh conditions
customer_reviews.text: This microwave has been in my tractor trailer for 29 months over 250000 miles and used daily. When the turntable squeaks i clean it and a lil shot of WD. I needed a dial microwave because sometimes running off an inverter some appliances do not do well with computer panels boards This one is finally getting tired so I am ordering a new one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for utility rig
customer_reviews.text: I had been searching for a microwave to run off of my 1000 watt pure sine inverter in my work van. The max draw on this is rated at 950 watt, and even on full cook power level, it doesn't overload the inverter. Its simple and easy tp use, and the carousel is actually on a peg, so it doesnt slide around as easily as the others. Ive only used it once so far, but i Highly recommend this microwave!
customer_reviews.author: Natascha

customer_reviews.title: ... for my mom who is 85 and has very poor eyesight Very simple and easy to operate - just ...
customer_reviews.text: Must have for elderly I’ve been looking for something for my mom who is 85 and has very poor eyesight Very simple and easy to operate - just the turn of the knob does the job She can heat up her meals now without frustration and burned plates Amassing product thank you for care for the elderly!!!! Many many thanks God bless you!
customer_reviews.author: YELENA S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave for Seniors!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect microwave for me-it's simple w 2 knobs you turn for heat level and time to cook. When done a bell rings. Don't be fooled by 600 Watts, this mighty machine gets the job done, it also comes with a glass turn table, so don't buy one. I also purchased some cooking accessories and 2 cookbooks. Why am I sharing all this? Because older folks who can afford to purchase one, should; food preparation will be simpler, cooked faster and enable folks to eat better nutrition. I bought mine from Open Box/Warehouse Deals, only the original box was messed, but the microwave arrived in pristine condition, was well packed and at a great price. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.58

customer_reviews.title: Simple and small microwave oven that fits in a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple and small microwave oven that fits in a small kitchen. Dial type control, one for setting, the second to start the oven and set the time. One negative is that the oven starts again as soon as the door closes if you open it before the time is up, instead of having a start button, so you have to turn the dial off if you find the food cooked. Small width, so normal dome type food cover did not fit. Inexpensive, so met the need in an independent living facility for a senior.
customer_reviews.author: Gardening Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very low cost, works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we were looking for. We were looking for something cheap, something simple, something that works well. This fit the bill and more. We couldn’t be happier with this unit. As someone who is visually impaired, this is very simple to operate and even I can use this unit with no problem. We are waiting for her really expensive microwave to be repaired and while we wait, this is what we are using. For me, this works better. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Alfred FredelTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: The unit arrived in great shape, it was double boxed for protection and ...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on the exact last day estimated, but it arrived on time. The unit arrived in great shape, it was double boxed for protection and it is much more quiet than my last unit and I noticed that the rotary plate turns faster and smoother than my old unit too. So all in all, I am very happy with this replacement unit. I hope to get many years of service from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin E. Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 4 months, by then return and support was expired. Do not buy, it’s junk.
customer_reviews.author: mskitty

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Operate
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy. Simple to ooerate. Little to go wrong (no electronics). Perfect for light to medium use purposes. Not the best for meal prep, but warming up ... PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Slippin' and slidin'
customer_reviews.text: Nice little micro for the price. Easy to operate and fits in a small space. Cons: slides around on a countertop unless you put a mat underneath, and 2) a cup slides all over the glass tray as the tray rotates unless there is something (I put a paper towel) under it. I'm surprised that some sort of mat for this is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Adams

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use.  No buttons to push.  Twist on and off.  No lengthy directions to read.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as my 16+ year old Westinghouse microwave, that it replaces. Has different power settings which are noisy when shifting. Power shift unnecessary. High power reheats coffee, defrosts food and cooks. I like the smaller Microsoft plate which stays anchored in place. I wanted the circular dial for its easy use. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: You can change the power so some foods won't be overcooked. It has a turntable so food can cook evenly. It's a shiny black color, which looks nice on a counter. It was easy to set up. However, it was a little pricey. So, overall, I think it deserves 4 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore

customer_reviews.title: Great small microwave
customer_reviews.text: Works great! However, it is an analogue microwave -- no buttons, just dials. And the alert noise -- when it's done cooking -- is a hilarious "tink" sound. "Every time the microwave is done, an angel gets its wings."
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Rattles a bit
customer_reviews.text: I only use a microwave for reheating food or defrosting meat. I like this one but it does rattle a bit when in use. My old one was much quieter. However, it does what I need it to do so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Simple, basic, small microwave.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simply, small microwave. This was it. I would give it 5-stars but for one limitation. The dial is "analog". You turn it to select the time, like an old-fashioned kitchen timer. But the range from 0 to 2 minutes is too small of a distance. Not really a problem for what I use it for, but if you want exactly 30 seconds or 1 minute, then this probably isn't for you. But it is simple. And it seems to heat up food more quickly than our large microwave with 42 different dials and settings.
customer_reviews.author: Not my dog

customer_reviews.title: If there were good old days for microwaves, I guess this fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: If your microwave needs are minimal, this item doesn't take space, is simple to use, and quiet. It's as basic as you can get. So if you don't cook in a microwave and don't need presets, or if you lack space, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my RV.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my RV. The first one I recieved had been dropped on the corner and was damaged and bent. It must have been a customer return because the original packaging for the glass turntable wasn't there. Returned it and got an unmolested one that works fine.
customer_reviews.author: nobissellforme

customer_reviews.title: I Love It
customer_reviews.text: It sits on my kitchen counter, with several inches to spare before the cabinet starts. I love it because it's small and the dial starts the microwave and there isn't unnecessary button pushing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Eppes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Microwave , Super Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this microwave for our elder aunt and we wanted a very simple microwave that she could use without any issues and this is the one! This has very easy to use turn controls, NO digital displays which is what we wanted. The microwave heats up super quick and so far it’s been doing a great job. The only negative is that there is NO interior light but for the price you can’t beat this one!
customer_reviews.author: Nor'easter

customer_reviews.title: I decided it is my best interest to return this for another one so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I hope this is just a one in a million issue - when I go this, I found that the control panel would come off ... Weight the fact that I may be prone to electrocution, I decided it is my best interest to return this for another one so I do hope that the next one will be issue free...
customer_reviews.author: Johnny W.

customer_reviews.title: only two dials!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it only has two dials: one for time, and one for power. I don't know why microwaves have dozens of buttons and "features". There are only two things to control on a microwave oven (time and power) so they only need two controls. So it's super easy for anyone to use.
customer_reviews.author: Byron J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Simple, reliable microwave
customer_reviews.text: It's not a large microwave, but it's very easy to use, since it just has two dials, and so far, reliable.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great for heating water
customer_reviews.text: Simple, basic, and small. Great for heating water, soup, bake potatoes, etc. Takes longer than more powerful ones, but it's good for us. The small size makes it fit really well for kitchens with limited counter space and fits nicely under overhead cupboards with room on top for a tray and extra storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had a clock ... but still a good value.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that I didn't notice that it doesn't have a clock. A timer, yes ... but no clock, and I miss it. OTOH, it was inexpensive, does exactly what it's supposed to do, and takes up less counter space (than my old one).
customer_reviews.author: K. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom. She bought one just like it a couple of years ago, mainly because it had knobs and was easy to use. The other one quit recently, sooner than it should have, but she wanted another one that was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: EagleBeagle

customer_reviews.title: They love it and it was the right size and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for inlaws! They love it and it was the right size and the analog switches are just what was needed due to poor eyesight!
customer_reviews.author: Ardvaark1965

customer_reviews.title: Did it’s job for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: Microwave is less than two years old. I expected it to last longer but I suppose for the money it was not a bad buy. I will not buy again. I have purchased a better brand. However, the time it lasted but did a superb job.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, easy and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandfather, it is simple to use. Its been a couple years now and still works great!
customer_reviews.author: irene

customer_reviews.title: I admit I was glad to see it go
customer_reviews.text: R.I.P. Westinghouse Microwave. This lasted exactly 23 months from the date of order until the rainy evening when it decided to heat no more. It still makes the noise and lights up, but no warming whatsoever. With no small guilt, I admit I was glad to see it go. The analog controls offer so little precise control that you will over-heat or under-heat constantly. An essentially disposable electronic product that will soon be clogging up in our landfills and oceans. On the plus side, it is extraordinarily inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy of use for elderly.
customer_reviews.text: Great microwave for a 96 year old grandma. It is self explanatory in use and it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Emi M

customer_reviews.title: Shipped broken or damaged during delivery?
customer_reviews.text: Delivered broken. The foam inserts were pulverized and the microwave rattled when I took it out of the box. I took a risk and tried it out anyway. Nothing happened. Not suprised. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Newmom

customer_reviews.title: Works, but needs babysitting
customer_reviews.text: I don't know whether to give this 4 or 5 stars - it works as intended, but 600 watts and an analog timer makes it very hard to get food "right" without constantly checking it. Even if I get it right the first time, setting the timer to exactly the same spot is impossible, and when you have to make so many adjustments to the recommended cooking time (since it's so weak), it makes things difficult. It works, but it's a pain.
customer_reviews.author: A.Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and it's the product I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to defrost and cook small items, and to boil water for tea. This fits in the space available for it, and does the job well that I want it to do. It is not a powerful microwave by any means, so it takes a little longer to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: OK microwave, nice and small
customer_reviews.text: I use this microwave to cook food in my Semi truck, i can run it off of the 1200w inverter and it does fine, cooking times need to be a little longer than the food packages say sometimes because the wattage is kinda low. The mechanism that runs the turn table is starting to make some petty creepy and grindy noises, but seeing as though this thing has been bouncing around in the cabinet on my Cascadia for the past 6 months, I'm not surprised. As long as no microwaves are leaking out and nuking me, it's ok. Id imagine the more expensive microwaves made for RV's are build to handle all the bouncing and vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for seniors or anyone who is technologically challenged
customer_reviews.text: My friend is 85 she gets very confused about how to use the push button microwaves. This microwave to the complication out of her fixing a meal. It was truly a blessing that they actually make these retro models still. Highly recommend for seniors or anyone who is technologically challenged.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my office and it works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office and it works perfectly. On the one hand, having the knob is super-easy to use, but since there's a little play, it is a little difficult to know if you actually set it to one minute or a minute and a half. Normally not a big deal, but some things that I reheat, that 30 seconds can make a difference between just right and a little too much. If my home microwave went out, I might even consider this as a replacement because of the simplicity and the fact that I use a microwave simply to re-heat things and not as an actual cooking appliance.
customer_reviews.author: DaveSFL

customer_reviews.title: Simple and well made
customer_reviews.text: I like the simple, easy to operate controls, plus the handle that's integral with the door. The handles on my last two (much more complicated and expensive) models loosened and eventually came off.
customer_reviews.author: T J Wizard

customer_reviews.title: You pay more for less
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave to fit into an awkward space above my refrigerator. I passed up many cheaper options that produce much more power, simply because I don't use a microwave too often. One pretty major downside is the lack of any precise time inputs. Only a few degrees of rotation of the knob will give you an extra two or three minutes of cook time. furthermore, if you open the door and grab your food and there' still time left on the timer, the oven will turn back on once you close the door.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: A good, simple microwave
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted: very simply controls, no digital clock to reset, easy to open/close/clean, smallish for my tiny kitchen. Two minor drawbacks: 1) It maxes out at just 600 watts. I don't buy much processed frozen food, but the first thing I bought listed timing for an 1100-watt oven. Plan to heat longer than some packages may suggest. 2) Analog timer isn't very precise and timing for seconds isn't possible without an auxiliary timer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carpus

customer_reviews.title: It does the job just fine! No problems and have had for almost 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this microwave because I live in a tiny, 350 square foot apartment. It does the job just fine! No problems and have had for almost 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Use it mainly for tatters
customer_reviews.text: Love the old school dials! Just turn the dial and it starts. Open the door and it stops. The simple life....
customer_reviews.author: ssippishark

customer_reviews.title: Terrible service- only worked two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: The service on the product was terrible, After using it for 2 weeks it stopped working. Called Westinghouse they had us send in the label and cord. We have called twice, we know they received the items they promised to send us a new unit- NOTHING!!! Terrible product, terrible service. We called they had no way to check and see what the status was.
customer_reviews.author: LHaynes

customer_reviews.title: ... a little over a year and it still works fine. In a house with 7 young adults it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a little over a year and it still works fine. In a house with 7 young adults it gets plenty of use. Unfortunately it now makes a horrible grinding noise. Something to do with the spinning-plate-thing. Super annoying, but I'm sure it could be fixed with a bit of know-how.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly in Rockford

customer_reviews.title: I like the manual aspect of the microwave i
customer_reviews.text: I like the manual aspect of the microwave i.e. no digital readout, but this microwave does not warm the center of my food 9 out of 10 times using it. Something to consider when you would rather just heat and eat.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fogle

customer_reviews.title: This works ok. It just takes twice to three ...
customer_reviews.text: This works ok. It just takes twice to three times longer as the wattage is much lower. We bought it so we would use it with our small generator in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse should do better
customer_reviews.text: I liked the simplicity of use, and the price was good. I am not returning it since I have adapted to the main problem with this microwave. You have to give the door a real tug to open it, and when you do that the whole microwave moves forward with the door. I solved the problem by putting a quilted placemat under it, but am still securing it with one hand while opening the door with the other. I am sure others have worked out their own solutions, but they shouldn't have to do so. This is a case where I bought something inexpensive, trusting the brand name. Westinghouse should have corrected that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Barely one year old and it crapped out just after the warranty. Perfect timing
customer_reviews.text: Barely one year old and it crapped out just after the warranty. Perfect timing. Thought there was something metal in it but there wasn’t the whole thing was just sparking and smoking. Garbage
customer_reviews.author: Diane Allen

customer_reviews.title: This product caught on fire after only a few days of use!
customer_reviews.text: This cute little microwave explodes and caught on fire and I am lucky it didn’t burn the house down! Something was definitely wrong with it and I will not buy again! Dangerous PS It is brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and it doesn't take a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and it doesn't take a lot of space. I've had for about a month now and I haven't had any issue; so far this item ranks high in my two most important factors: cost and easy to use. I'm happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Microwave
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new microwave as the electronic controls had been "temperamental" on mine for more than a year. I use a microwave for reheating meals, steaming veggies, making popcorn and melting butter so I'm not a heavy user. This has no electronic controls to get buggy. It doesn't take up much real estate on my limited countertop. It's white and it's clean looking and it's super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LeslieE

customer_reviews.title: Love my microwave
customer_reviews.text: I only use my microwave oven for heating up food and drinks. I also have a very small kitchen. This microwave doesn't take up a lot of space. I have it in a storage cabinet so it doesn't use up storage space. I love how easy the controls are to use. For some food, like popcorn, I do have to microwave it a little longer but I don't mind that. It fits my needs perfectly in every other way.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Warrick

customer_reviews.title: Great size and wattage!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and wattage microwave. Just what i was looking for..compact and the low wattage that goes great in my mobile office. Hooks up to my inverter and heats up my lunch just as it should. The knobs are very easy to control and doesn't have none of those fancy pre-programmed buttons.
customer_reviews.author: J. Penate

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse 600 Watt Microwave Oven
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive microwave for light duty use. I was pleasantly surprised to find this product available from Amazon. The unit is 600 watt, which is just fine for heating up most things - just takes a little while longer. It also has a rotating carousel inside the oven, for even heating. Form, fit and finish are all excellent. Overall, I would say this unit is an incredible bargain and would recommend it for a college dorm or small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Curl aka RedonKiLaus

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this Microwave functions perfectly and does everything you need. Meaning, put something in, it comes out nice and warm after a prescribed period of time. I needed something small and this was the best I could find. I only gave it four stars because of the analog timer. I am assuming this is a cost-cutting measure, which is cool, but it means you need to use another timer and pay careful attention if you want it to run for a very specific amount of time. I just use the timer on the oven, and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: If you are look to give a gift to a senior this is it...
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel H.

customer_reviews.title: plan jane
customer_reviews.text: if u want a durable microwave for a small apartment, its a good buy. the light may only come on while its running and it has knobs instead of a key pad but its low wattage feature makes it able to be used on low amperage circuits. no bells and whistles but its a solid unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Commercial Chef CHM660B Countertop Small Microwave Oven, 0.6 Cubic Feet, Black
product_meta.description: With the Commercial Chef CHM660B microwave oven you get 600 watts of cooking power and a . 6 cubic foot interior. Easy to use mechanical dials allow you to set the timer that ranges from 1 to 30 minutes and to Select from among the six cooking power levels. Great for anyone living with in a small area like a dorm or apartment as it won’t take up much space but yet still gives the convenience of quickly cooking your food. Use correct cooking time and power level.
feature_bullets: Kitchen countertop mini microwave ovens for preparing snacks, heating up last night's leftovers, or food preparation
Durable strong construction with a Black front display and cabinet for compact durability
Easy to grasp grip type handle to open and close this rotary microwave
Mechanical, rotary dial controls make it great for those seeking simple, basic operation
Speed and Weight defrost allows for multiple uses in the kitchen

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,146 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
